articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Nexus between U.S. and Japan for Nuclear War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Nexus between U.S. and Japan for Nuclear War
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Abe, when asked by a Diet man at a recent meeting of the Budget Committee of the House of Representatives about whether there was a secret agreement between the U.S. and Japan on the introduction of nuclear weapons in the 1960s, answered that it was wrong for the successive regimes of the Liberal Democratic Party to persistently fail to let the people know about it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is little short of the Japanese chief executive's full revelation that the U.S. moves to launch a nuclear war in Northeast Asia in conspiracy with Japan started as early as in the 1960s.
					
					 It is the U.S. aggressive scenario to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula after turning south Korea and Japan into nuclear outposts, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Herein lies the reason why the U.S. imperialists signed a secret agreement with their junior ally in the 1960s.
					
					 Huge nuclear offensive means of the U.S. forces deployed in Japan are aimed to carry out the strategy for a nuclear war against the DPRK.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the U.S. has staged ceaseless war exercises under various codenames in south Korea and Japan in recent years with nuclear force involved.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have oft-repeated "three non-nuclear principles" as regards the danger of a nuclear war prevailing on the Korean peninsula but offered their territory to their American master as a nuclear base, hatching plots with the U.S. behind scene. This sinister scenario should not be overlooked. 
					
					 Nuclear arming is the invariable ambition of Japan and it is a strategic goal for turning Japan into a military giant.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries consider nuclear arming as a prospect for realizing their ambition for overseas expansion. It is their view that the stepped-up nuclear arming would help them launch overseas aggression and the operation for conquering the world as they please.
					
					 If the U.S. is truly concerned about nuclear threat, it had better get serious about the poisonous mushroom growing under its "nuclear umbrella."
					
					 If it is truly interested in peace and nuclear disarmament, it should on longer pursue wild ambition for preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK and immediately halt nuclear war exercises scheduled to be held in south Korea.

articles.title: Cancellation of Projected Joint Military Drills Demanded
articles.content:
Cancellation of Projected Joint Military Drills Demanded
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration issued a statement on Feb. 7 urging the south Korean authorities to cancel the projected joint military drills with the U.S., according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The statement noted that the authorities should cancel the projected joint military drills with the U.S. for peace on the Korean peninsula and the development of the south-north relations, though belatedly.

articles.title: Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Russian, Polish Personages
articles.content:
Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Russian, Polish Personages
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Personages of Russia and Poland released statements on Jan. 23 and 27 in support of the crucial proposal made by the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					Zakidkin, first vice-chairman of the Moscow Veterans' Committee of Russia, said:
					
					The NDC of the DPRK sent a crucial proposal to the south Korean authorities to mend the inter-Korean relations and protect peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					The south Korean authorities should cancel their projected joint military drills with the U.S. as they will increase the danger of war and harass peace and security on the peninsula.
					
					It is natural for the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear deterrence for self-defence to cope with the nuclear threat of the U.S. and its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					We positively support the crucial proposal made by the NDC of the DPRK to pave a broad avenue for improving the north-south relations.
					
					Juzef Lachut, a member of the National Executive Committee of the Polish Communist Party and chairman of the Executive Committee of the Warsaw Regional Committee of the party, said:
					
					The crucial proposal of the NDC of the DPRK is of very great significance in ensuring peace and security on the peninsula.
					
					We express our full support to the DPRK's proposal for creating an atmosphere for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Hailed by Nepalese Paper
articles.content:
Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Hailed by Nepalese Paper
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese paper Arpan carried an article titled "Peace and war drills can never go together" on Jan. 31.
					 The paper noted:
					
					 The National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK proposed the south Korean authorities to take practical measures to create a climate for mending the inter-Korean relations and protect security and peace of the nation.
					
					 Peace is desired by all Koreans.
					
					 All Koreans desire peace, not a war, and co-existence and common interests of the north and the south, not division and confrontation. 
					
					 Peace is prerequisite to the existence and development of the Korean nation but war drills are a main factor of threatening its existence hour by hour.
					
					 If another war breaks out on the Korean peninsula, this would bring horrible disasters to the Korean nation.
					
					 Peace provides a sure guarantee for Korea's reunification and common prosperity of the nation.
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities, defying these urgent requirements of the reality, are going to stage large-scale Key Resolve and Foal Eagle with the U.S. against the DPRK from late in February.
					
					 Peace and war drills can never go together.

articles.title: Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Swedish, Austrian Organizations
articles.content:
Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Swedish, Austrian Organizations
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Sweden and Austria issued statements on January 29 and 30 in support of the crucial proposal of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said that it welcomes the crucial proposal of the NDC of the DPRK giving clear answers to problems arising in improving the north-south relations.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 It is necessary to mend the north-south ties in order to achieve the peaceful reunification by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 The above-said proposal is one step forward for improving the north-south relations and the south Korean authorities should immediately respond to it.
					
					 Only when the north and the south stop the smear campaign and hostile military acts against the other side as proposed by the NDC of the DPRK, can trust and cooperation be achieved.
					
					 The NDC stressed that the DPRK's nuclear force is a means for deterring the U.S. nuclear threats to it.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear force is by no means for blackmailing against its country fellowmen and hurting them.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not introduce the U.S. nukes into the Korean peninsula and deny the DPRK's nukes.
					
					 Now is the time for the south Korean authorities to stop remaining servants of the U.S. imperialists and enemy of the Korean nation but opt for cooperation and detente between the north and the south.
					
					 The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK extended full support to the crucial proposal sent by the NDC of the DPRK to the south Korean authorities, stressing that supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address called for defusing the tension on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It said that it would render positive cooperation to the Korean people in their efforts to realize the above-said proposal.

articles.title: Crucial Proposal and Open Letter of NDC of DPRK Favored by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Crucial Proposal and Open Letter of NDC of DPRK Favored by Foreign Organizations
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Uganda and DR Congo made public statements in support of the crucial proposal and open letter of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK on Jan. 28 and 30.
					 The Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement noted:
					
					 We can never tolerate foreign interference in the internal affairs of the DPRK and acts of harassing peace in the region.
					
					 We, therefore, fully support the crucial proposal made by the NDC of the DPRK.
					
					 Any slightest accidental conflict would lead to a total war, a nuclear disaster which would lead to the end of the world.
					
					 We call for seriously dealing with such development and making due efforts for protecting peace.
					
					 The Association for Implementing the Juche Philosophy of DR Congo said it received with great interest the crucial proposal and open letter of the NDC of the DPRK, adding:
					
					 The present international situation teaches a historic lesson that a country can achieve its national prosperity when it is united, but will fall victim to the imperialists' interests when it is divided.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should see through the ulterior design of the U.S. to fish in troubled waters by seeking permanent division of Korea.
					
					 We urge the south Korean authorities to positively respond to the sincere efforts of the DPRK to achieve peace and reunification of Korea by the concerted efforts of all Koreans.
					
					 We extend our full support and solidarity to the policy of independent and peaceful reunification set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Unconditional Halt to Projected U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills Urged by Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
Unconditional Halt to Projected U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills Urged by Bulgarian Organization
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association carried in its bulletin an article supporting the crucial proposal made by the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK on Jan. 29.
					 The bulletin said:
					
					 On January 16 the NDC of the DPRK sent a crucial proposal to the south Korean authorities to create an atmosphere of reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south and ensure peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The NDC proposed taking practical measures to completely stop provoking and slandering each other and all military hostile acts against the other side and to prevent a nuclear disaster on the peninsula.
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities are taking a negative stand towards the constructive proposal made by the DPRK.
					
					 This is arousing great concern among the world peace-loving people who hope for reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south and detente on the peninsula.
					
					 Large-scale joint military drills are incompatible with peace and they should be halted unconditionally.

articles.title: Preparatory Committee for Celebrating Day of Shining Star Inaugurated in Norway
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee for Celebrating Day of Shining Star Inaugurated in Norway
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- A Norwegian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Ostfold County on Feb. 3.
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, and Rita Berger, chief of the Ostfold Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, were elected co-chairpersons of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated by Indonesian Party
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated by Indonesian Party
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee of the Diversity Party of Indonesia for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of Shining Star) was formed on February 3.
					 Nurdin Purnomo, chairman of the National Leading Council of the party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold political and cultural events in praise of the exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Uganda
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Uganda
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated with due ceremony at the building of the Secretariat of the Uganda National Resistance Movement on Feb. 3. 
					 Speakers at the inaugural ceremony said that Kim Jong Il is always alive in the hearts of world progressives including the African people for his undying exploits performed for the global cause of independence.
					
					 Kirunda Kivejinja, senior adviser to the Ugandan president, was elected as adviser to the preparatory committee and Henri Masico, department director of the Presidency, as chairman of the committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events such as meeting, seminar and photo exhibition on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in France
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in France
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" was made public in booklet by the Democrate Publishing House of France with the approach of his birth anniversary. 
					 This work, published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), stresses that invincible might of the DPRK lies in preserving and glorifying forever President Kim Il Sung's idea of the Juche-oriented nation-building and his exploits performed in it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Peruvian Organization
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism released a statement on Jan. 30 with the approach of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 We warmly congratulate the Korean people greeting the 72nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il was the great thinker and theoretician who opened a new phase of development of human thought and theory by developing in depth the Juche idea, man-centered philosophical idea and revolutionary idea centered on the popular masses, fathered by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The validity and vitality of the Juche idea is publicly recognized in the world.
					
					 Kim Jong Il scientifically proved the inevitability of the victory of socialism in the struggle against the moves of the imperialists and defended the destiny of socialism with the Songun idea and the Songun politics. 
					
					 He made a great contribution to carrying out the socialist cause and the cause of independence against imperialism with his superhuman self-sacrificing spirit and dedication. 
					
					 His idea and exploits are being invariably carried forward and developed by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The idea and exploits of Kim Jong Il will be immortal as a signpost of victory for the Korean people and other progressives of the world.
